author: superlouis.eth
content:
Hello <@453386940490711054> !
So I tested the submission to my Nimbus node. Without much surprise, it wasn't accepted: 
`Error: failed to process: failed to submit BLS to execution change: POST failed with status 400: {"code":400,"message":"Unable to decode BLS to execution change object(s)","stacktraces":["Attempt to add to BLS to execution change pool pre-Capella"]}`

author: superlouis.eth
content: Do you think there is a strong need of volunteers and I should temporarily switch to another client, or it's fine if I run it again manually after the fork? I can write a script once we know the capella fork block

author: benjaminchodroff
content: Prysm, lighthouse and lodestar will accept local submissions in cache prior to Capella, and broadcast at Capella. If you want, we do have a “rescuer” bot to help volunteer on other clients such as Teku and nimbus, but as our code is unaudited we don’t recommend it to non-developers: https://github.com/benjaminchodroff/ConsensusLayerWithdrawalProtection/tree/main/rescuer
